    Laurits Stapput Knudsen

    PhD Candidate in Linguistics

    • University of Newcastle, Australia
    • Laurits.knudsen@uon.edu.au
    • Website
    • Twitter
    • GitHub

    CV

    Education

    Ph.D. Candidate, linguistics, University of Newcastle (Australia), 2021-

    • Thesis (working) title: Landscape, Culture, Cognition, and Language: A Fieldwork-Based Investigation of Inter- and Intracommunity Variation
      Supervisors: A/prof. Bill Palmer and Dr. Catriona Malau

    M.A., Linguistics, University of Copenhagen, 2021
    Specialization in functional cognitive linguistics

    • Thesis: Pragmatic and Synctactic Influence on Pronoun Resolution: A Psycholinguistic Study of the Coreference Resolution of Danish Possessive Pronouns
      Supervisor: Prof. Elisabeth Engberg-Pedersen

    B.A, Linguistics, University of Copenhagen, 2018

    Skills

    Technical

    Linguistic software: ELAN, FLEx, Praat, AegisSub
    Basic programming: Python, R, LaTeX
    Geo-information: QGIS

    Languages

    Danish: Fluent
    English: Fluent
    Spanish: Basic communication skills
    German: Good comprehension

    I have experience working with several varieties of the Indigenous Mexican language Nahuatl and a highly endangered variety of the Indigenous language Otomí.

    Scientific research

    I have experience with the following areas of scientific research:

    • Data pipelines (data collection, data management, transcription, annotation, analysis, visualisation)
    • Linguistic Fieldwork
    • Experimental design (mouse-tracking, eye-tracking)
    • Production of elicitation materials
    • Instructing team members in specialised software and data collection
    • Public presentation, academic publication

    Research experience

    Research Intern, University of Copenhagen, 2020

    • Researching linguistic and cognitive preferences regarding the use of different orientational systems in two varieties of Nahuatl as part of the Nahuatl Space Project.

    Student assistant, IT-university of Copenhagen, 2018-2020

    • Annotating linguistic material for a Danish treebank project, and I writing annotation guidelines for future annotators.

    Student Assistant, MIRSK, 2018

    • Annotating linguistic data for automatic speech-processing software.

    Student Assistant, University of Copenhagen, 2017

    • Collecting and processing data for a project on the vocabulary of 5th graders.

    Research Assistant, Linguistic Fieldwork, 2017

    • Documentation of the highly endangered language Acazulco Otomí in Mexico.

    Teaching experience

    Sprogliga, 2017-2019

    • I have been responsible for teaching general linguistics and problem solving to Danish high schoolers to prepare them for participation in the IOL (International Linguistics Olympiad).

    TalentCampDK, 2016-2019

    • I have been responsible for planning and teaching various courses in a broad range of linguistic subjects. TalentCampDK is an educational offer for gifted 7-9th grade students.

    Grants

    Frøken Maria Månssons legat, 2020

    • Travel grant to fund fieldwork in Mexico (10.000 DKK)

    Københavns Universitets Internationaliseringsstipendium, 2017

    • Travel grant for exchange studies at University of California (8.000 DKK), not utilised

    Professional memberships

    Australian Linguistics Society, 2021-

    The Linguistic Circle of Copenhagen, 2015-

    The Society for the Study of the Indigenous Languages of the Americas, 2020-2021

    Posts of responsibility

    Member of quota 2-admission committee, Linguistics, University of Copenhagen, 2020

    Team Leader for the Danish IOL (International Linguistics Olympiad) team, 2017-2020

    Member of committee, the Linguistic Circle of Copenhagen, 2016-2020

    Member of organising committee, Sprogvidenskabelig Studenterkonference, 2016-2020

    Chairman, linguistic Student Council, University of Copenhagen, 2016-2019
